data.text:
@Mooby_Doo @JohnRuddick2 It's in the sources section, although that might be paywalled.
However, I may have found a solution for this Russian export problem. https://t.co/Pu00XT0ZmP
@JamesMcCathie @JohnRuddick2 Where in your link does it say that Russia's attributed production is mining country of origin.?

@JohnRuddick2 Not 100% on that. Russia was in 2020 but Indonesia is listed as highest producer (not exporter) in 2021. In any case Russia is top 3. No problem with the general inflation thesis but picking a single commodity with strong Russia sanctions exposure is not “proof”.
@Mooby_Doo @JohnRuddick2 ... yeah if you're not going to even read what I just said this conversation isn't going to progress anywhere.

@JohnRuddick2 @lattenomics Of course it has to do with the crippling of supply chain issues due to Government Covid response measures @lattenomics 
You don't simply stop/start supply chains.
@JohnRuddick2 They can now blame it all on Putin.

@Mooby_Doo @JohnRuddick2 No it doesn't. A Russian company does. They mine nickel from many places around the world. Mostly Indonesia.

https://t.co/2XgPc5AS6E https://t.co/zVUXRa03tX
@JohnRuddick2 Short squeeze and financial speculators getting punished in nickel’s particular case

@ralphbuttigieg @JohnRuddick2 https://t.co/I9wz60wyJ7

This is far deeper than just Russia or renewables.
